Requirements:
To be considered for admission to the BASW Program, students must meet the following minimum requirements:
1. Must be a continuing CSULB student in good academic standing.
2. Must have Junior status (60 units) at the time of program entry.
3. Must have a cumulative GPA of 2.5 or higher.
4. Must have completed all Lower Division General Education Foundation courses with a C or better.
5. Must have completed the following Pre-Social Work Core courses with a C or better: SW 220, SW 221, plus one course from ANTH 120, SOC 100, or SOC 142.
6. Must complete a separate BASW Program Application by the deadline during the Spring semester.
7. Must submit TWO letters of recommendation with your BASW Program Application.
8. Must complete an essay with your BASW Program Application.
9. Must have a minimum of 100 hours of volunteer/paid work experience in a social service agency completed prior to applying.
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in Social Work

Requirements:
To be considered for admission to CSU Long Beach, First-Time, First-Year students must meet the following requirements:
1. Be a high school graduate or have the equivalent.
2. Complete the 15-unit comprehensive "a-g" pattern of college preparatory courses.
3. Have a qualifying "a-g" grade point average (GPA).

California residents must have a 2.50 or greater “a-g” GPA. Non-California residents must have a 3.00 or greater “a-g” GPA. The GPA is based on the “a-g” courses taken during the 10th and 11th grades of high school. The CSU does not use the plus/minus grading system for GPA calculation.

Requirements:
All applicants must apply during the initial filing period of October 1 through November 30. All applicants must meet the regular university admission requirements for the level at which they are applying (e.g., freshman, transfer). Due to the high-demand for this major, it has been declared 'impacted' and requires that applicants meet additional requirements. Refer to the 'Freshman Admission' and 'Transfer Admission' sections of this catalog for the most current criteria.

Freshman applicants must complete a core of high school courses. To be considered 'eligible' for the major, an applicant must have a Math Index of 3 or 4 by having completed Algebra I, Geometry, and Algebra II, and being enrolled in or having completed a math course with Algebra II as a prerequisite, and have a minimum unweighted GPA of 2.5.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Construction Management

Requirements: All applicants must complete the Cal State Apply online application and pay the application fee. Freshman applicants must have completed the required A-G college preparatory courses in high school with a qualifying grade point average. International applicants must also submit official academic records, proof of English language proficiency (such as TOEFL or IELTS scores), a Financial Affidavit of Support with a bank statement, and a copy of their passport. For Fall 2025 applicants, CSULB will not consider SAT or ACT test scores for admission purposes.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Environmental Engineering

Requirements: To be considered for admission to CSULB as a freshman, you must be a high school graduate, have completed the 'a-g' college preparatory subject requirements with a grade of C- or better, and have a qualifying 'a-g' GPA. The Environmental Science and Public Policy major does not have additional major-specific admission requirements beyond the university's general requirements.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Environmental Science and Public Policy

Requirements:
Admission under Impaction: Refer to the Family and Consumer Sciences section of this catalog for details on impaction.
Major Specific Declaration Requirements: Students must earn a “C” or better in FCS 200, HDEV 190, NUTR 132, and PSY 100 before declaring the major and enrolling in any 300 level FCS courses.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Family and Consumer Sciences, Option in Child Development and Family Studies

Requirements: To be considered for freshman admission, applicants must be a high school graduate, have completed the required 15-unit comprehensive 'a-g' pattern of college preparatory courses, and have a qualifying 'a-g' GPA. Transfer applicants must meet minimum California State University eligibility requirements, including having 60 or more transferable semester units, a qualifying GPA, and completion of specific general education courses.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Family and Consumer Sciences, Option in Consumer Affairs

Requirements:
To be considered for admission to CSULB, freshman applicants must meet the following minimum requirements:
1. Complete the A-G course requirements with a grade of C- or better.
2. Have a 2.50 or greater GPA (for California residents or graduates of a California high school) or a 3.00 or greater GPA (for non-residents of California or non-graduates of a California high school).
3. Graduate from high school or have the legal equivalent of a high school diploma.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Family and Consumer Sciences, Option in Family Life Education

Requirements:
To be considered for admission to CSULB as a freshman, you must meet the following minimum requirements:
1. Be a high school graduate or have the legal equivalent of a high school diploma.
2. Complete the 15-unit comprehensive 'a-g' pattern of college preparatory courses. For admission, you must have a grade of 'C-' or better in each of the courses.
3. Earn a qualifying 'a-g' grade point average (GPA). California residents must have a minimum 2.50 GPA to be considered. Non-California residents must have a minimum 3.00 GPA to be considered.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Finance

Requirements:
Freshmen admission to the Geography major is 'major-specific.' Applicants will be considered for 'pre-major' status in Geography based on the general CSULB freshmen admissions criteria. To be considered for freshmen admission to CSULB, you must meet the following minimum requirements:
1. Be a high school graduate or have a General Education Development (GED) certificate.
2. Complete the 15-unit A-G college preparatory course pattern with a grade of C or better.
3. Meet the minimum eligibility index for your academic status.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Geography

Requirements: To be considered for admission to CSULB, first-time freshmen applicants must meet the following minimum requirements: 1. Graduation from high school or equivalent; 2. Completion of the 15-unit comprehensive 'a-g' pattern of college preparatory courses; 3. Have a qualifying 'a-g' grade point average (GPA). CSULB is impacted for all undergraduate programs, and admission is competitive.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Geology

Requirements:
Admission to the Basic BSN program is highly competitive. Applicants are ranked based on the following admission criteria:
1. Prerequisite GPA (a minimum of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is required)
2. Overall GPA (a minimum of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is recommended)
3. ATI TEAS Exam (a minimum of 75% on the adjusted individual total score is required)
4. Local Admission Preference
5. Health-related work/volunteer experience
6. Bilingual proficiency

Prerequisite Courses: Human Anatomy (with lab), Human Physiology (with lab), General, Organic, and Biochemistry with Lab, Microbiology with Lab, Written Communication, Oral Communication, Critical Thinking, and Statistics.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Nursing

Requirements:
The Minor in Comparative World Literature is available to any non-major. It requires completion of 18 units, distributed as follows:
1. Take one of the following courses (3 units): CWL 100, CWL 101, CWL 210.
2. Take 15 units of upper-division coursework in CWL.

No more than 6 units of this coursework may be from courses taken outside the department (approved by the CWL undergraduate advisor). At least 6 units must be from courses that deal primarily with non-Western and/or non-canonical literatures (approved by the CWL undergraduate advisor). A minimum of 9 units must be taken in residence at CSULB.

All courses in the minor must be passed with a grade of “C” or better. The minor must be completed with a minimum GPA of 2.0. A course may not be used to satisfy both major and minor requirements.
Program name: Minor in Comparative World Literature

Requirements:
The Creative Writing Minor requires 21 units.

Take two of the following introductory courses (6 units):
* ENGL 205 - Introduction to Creative Writing
* ENGL 206 - Introduction to Creative Writing: Poetry
* ENGL 207 - Introduction to Creative Writing: Fiction

Take four of the following intermediate/advanced courses (12 units):
* ENGL 305 - Intermediate Creative Writing
* ENGL 306 - Intermediate Creative Writing: Poetry
* ENGL 307 - Intermediate Creative Writing: Fiction
* ENGL 405 - Advanced Creative Writing
* ENGL 406 - Advanced Creative Writing: Poetry
* ENGL 407 - Advanced Creative Writing: Fiction
* ENGL 408 - Creative Writing: The Short Story
* ENGL 409 - The Writer’s Profession
* ENGL 458 - Creative Non-Fiction

At least two of these courses must be at the 400 level.

Take one of the following literature courses (3 units):
* ENGL 363 - Poetry and Poetics
* ENGL 380 - Approaches to English Studies
* ENGL 465 - Modern and Contemporary American Literature
* ENGL 467 - Studies in a Major American Writer
* ENGL 475 - Studies in a Major British Writer
* ENGL 487 - Contemporary Literature
Program name: Minor in English Creative Writing

Program name: Minor in English Literature

Requirements:
To declare the Sociology Minor, students should go to the Sociology Department Office (MH-205) to file the appropriate form.

The Minor in Sociology consists of 18 units, including the following:
1. SOC 100, Principles of Sociology (3 units)
2. Three units of Sociology at the 200-level (3 units)
3. Twelve units of any upper-division Sociology courses (300- or 400-level) (12 units)
Program name: Minor in Sociology

Requirements: The TESOL Minor consists of 18 units and is available to all undergraduate students in good standing. Students must earn a “C” or better in all courses required for the minor. Completion of LING 170 with a grade of “C” or better is prerequisite to all upper-division courses in the minor.
Program name: Minor in Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages (TESOL)
